properties.name: Shenandoah National Park
properties.description: Shenandoah National Park

properties.name: Skyline Dr
properties.description: If you continue north from the northeastern end of the Blue Ridge Parkway, you will be on Skyline Dr. it traverses the lengh of Shenandoah National Park.

properties.name: Rockfish Gap
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 0

Rockfish Gap near Waynesboro Virginia, is the northern end of the Blue Ridge Parkway. To the North the parkway connects directly to Skyline Drive, which winds 105 miles through Shenandoah National Park. U.S. 250 and I-64 take you to Charlottesville to the east and Staunton to the west.

properties.name: Humpback Rocks Visitors Center
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I do not know why a range of mile markers is used.
Mile Markers 5 to 9.3

Humpback Rocks has a self-guiding trail through a collection of old Appalachian farm buildings. A hiking trail from the parking area (at mile 6.1) leads 0.75 mile to The Rocks, whose humped appearance gives the area its name. Greenstone self-guiding trail (8.8).

properties.name: Ravens Roost Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 10.7

Ravens Roost offers vistas of Torry Mountain and Shenandoah Valley to the west.

properties.name: George Washington National Forest
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 16

Sherando Lake is a recreation area in George Washington National Forest 4.5 miles from the parkway via VA.814. Swimming, picnicking, and camping. Fees charged.

properties.name: Whetstone Ridge
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 29

Whetstone Ridge provided many a mountain man with a fine-grained sharpening stone

properties.name: Yankee Horse Ridge Parking Area
properties.description:
Access to the Yankee Horse Ridge (probably a riding area). I do not believe the Wikipedia mile marker. The one below is as Wikipedia lists it. By my measurement with the line tool in DeLorme, the associated parking area is at mile marker 38.99. The Stillhouse Parking Area is closer to the mile marker listed below.


The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile marker 34.4

Yankee Horse Ridge supposedly is where a hard-riding Union soldier's horse fell and had to be shot. See a reconstructed spur of an old logging railroad by walking to Wigwam Falls.

properties.name: James River Overlook?
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 63.8

James River and the Kanawha Canal is where a footbridge leads across the river to the restored canal locks and exhibits. A self-guiding trail follows the river bluff.

properties.name: Upper Otter Creek Overlook
properties.description:
Wikipedia suggested ending this region at Mile Marker 63.6. However, their entire range is too far north according to my measurements. I suggest 60.48 to 69.22.

The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Markers 58 to 63.6

Otter Creek runs 10 miles down the Blue Ridge to the James River. Otter Lake (63.1), fishing, trail.

properties.name: Onion Mountain Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My measurement was 83.12 miles.
Mile Marker 71

Onion Mountain's short loop trail leads through rhododendron and mountain laurel.

properties.name: Fallingwater Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My measurements put this overlook at Mile Marker 86.41.
Mile Marker 83.4

Fallingwater Cascades can be seen along a 1.6 mile loop trail.

properties.name: Peaks of the Otter Recreation Area
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My measurements in DeLorme predict the mile marker will be 88.84.
Mile Marker 84 to 87

Peaks of Otter's spectacular views have been popular since the days of Thomas Jefferson. A shuttle bus provides service to Sharp Top. Fee Charged.

properties.name: Peaks of the Otter Dam and Lake
Sharp Top Mountain
properties.description: According to Wikipedia, you can access this mountain via a shuttle bus at Peaks of the Otter Recreation Area (to the North and below the mountain). See the placemark for the recreation area for more information.

properties.name: Roanoke Basin Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My measurements put this location at Mile Marker 116.1.
Mile Marker 114.9

Roanoke River Gorge opens before you from the overlook, after a 10-minute walk.
I found another Wikipedia line that appears to refer to this stop.

Mile Marker 129.6 Roanoke Valley Overlook gives a view of the largest community along the parkway. Reach the city via U.S. 220 (at milepost 121), VA-24 (at 112), and U.S. 460 (at 105).

properties.name: Explore Park
properties.description:
Virginia's Explore Park offical site I had a tough time figuring where to show this. The website helped but didn't provide an overall map. Neither DeLorme nor GE showed the area well.

The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker115.1

Virginia's Explore Park celebrates the state's role in Westward Expansion. Historic buildings, exhibits, and demonstrations. Fee charged.

properties.name: Roanoke Mountain Recreation Area
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 120.4

Roanoke Mountain Road is a 3.7-mile side trip. The one-way loop road takes you over the mountain for impressive views. Steep grades; towed vehicles prohibited.

properties.name: Roanoke Mountain
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 120.4

Roanoke Mountain Road is a 3.7-mile side trip. The one-way loop road takes you over the mountain for impressive views. Steep grades; towed vehicles prohibited.

properties.name: Roanoke Mountain Road
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I show the entrance to the road (which is one way) at mile marker 122.5.
Mile Marker 120.4

Roanoke Mountain Road is a 3.7-mile side trip. The one-way loop road takes you over the mountain for impressive views. Steep grades; towed vehicles prohibited.

properties.name: Smart View Recreation Area
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I show this at mile marker 156.1.
Mile Marker 154.5

Smart View is just that; go to the Trail Cabin built in the 1890's and you'll see "a right smart view," especially in early May when the dogwoods bloom.

properties.name: Rocky Knob Recreation Area
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I show this at mile marker 170.83.
Mile Markers 167 to 174

Rocky Knob rises like the cresting of a wave to overlook Rock Castle Gorge.

properties.name: Mabry Mill
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I show this at mile marker 177.71. (That would be where you would get off while going south.)
Mile Marker 176.1

Mabry Mill was operated by E.B. Mabry from 1910 to 1935. A trail leads you to his gristmill, sawmill, blacksmith shop, and to other exhibits. Old-time skills are demonstrated in the summer and fall.

properties.name: Ground Hog Mountian Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I show this at mile marker 190.65.
Mile Marker 188.8

Groundhog Mountain is a good place to see different kinds of rural fences: snake, Post-and-rail, picket and buck. Picnic grounds and observation tower.

properties.name: State Border
properties.description:
To the North (and,along the route, east): Virginia

To the South (and, along the route, west): North Carolina According to my measurements in DeLorme, this falls at mile marker 218.59. Note the mile markers do **not** reset at the state line like those for Interstates would. WikiPedia puts the milemarker for this point at 217.5

properties.name: Cumberland Knob?
properties.description:
Included since the recreation area with the same name is near here. That was included because it looks like access might be available to the recreation area from the parkway. Furthermore, Wikipedia listed this stop.
The following information is from Wikipedia. My estimate for the mile marker was 219.6.
Mile Marker 217.5

Cumberland Knob, at 2885 feet, is a delightful spot to walk through fields and woodlands.
I also found this in Wikipedia. It appears to be about the same location. I could not find more information other than what appears below.
Mile Marker 218.6

Fox Hunters Paradise, a 10-minute walk, is where hunters could listen to their hounds baying in the valley below.

properties.name: Cumberland Knob Recreation Area?
properties.description: I think there may be access to this from the parkway, but DeLorme shows the recreation area down the hill from the parkway.

properties.name: Brinegar Cabin
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My estimate of the mile marker is 240.1.
238.5 Brinegar Cabin was built by Martin Brinegar about 1880 and lived in until the 1930's when the homestead was purchased from his widow for the parkway, The original cabin stands here today.

properties.name: Doughton Park
properties.description:
Access appears to be from several side roads off of the parkway. The parkway also goes through the park itself along the perimeter.
The following information is from Wikipedia. My Estimate on the mile markers in the area is that you enter the park on the northeast at mile marker 240.1 and leave the park on the southwest at mile marker 246.21.
Mile Markers 238.5 to 244.7

Doughton Park was named for Congressman Robert L. Doughton, a staunch supporter and neighbor of the parkway. One of the best places to see deer. Campground.

properties.name: Northwest Trading Post
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I estimated the location from the mile marker. I could not find any proof of any location.
Mile Marker 258.6

Northwest Trading Post offers crafts from North Carolina's northwestern counties.

properties.name: Jumpinoff Rock Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I estimate the mile marker to be 262.31.
Mile Marker 260.6

Jumpinoff Rock, at the end of a short woodland trail, offers a beautiful vista.

properties.name: The Lump Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I estimate the mile marker to be 264.92.
Mile Marker 264.4

The Lump provides sweeping views of the forested foothills.

properties.name: Cascade Overlook
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My estimate of the mile marker is 273.37. There really is an overlook here according to DeLorme. However, the park described by the text below may or may not be here. I selected this piont as this is where the mile marker matched up.
Mile Marker 272

E. B. Jeffress Park has a self-guided trail to the Cascades. Another trail goes to the old cabin and church.

properties.name: Daniel Boone's Trace
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I based the location on the mile marker listed by Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 285.1

Daniel Boone's Trace, which Boone blazed to the West, crosses near here.

properties.name: Moses H Cone Memorial Park
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My measurements show this at mile markers 293.94 to 296.59.
Mile Markers 292 to 295

Moses H. Cone Memorial Park has hiking and horse trails. Flat top Manor houses the Parkway Craft Center. Fishing.

properties.name: Julian Price Memorial Park
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I show the park as being from mile markers 296.59 to 300.62.
Mile Markers 295.1 to 298

Julian Price Memorial Park, the former retreat of an insurance executive, offers a variety of short trails and a lake.

properties.name: Linn Cove Viaduct
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. Because I can not see the precise location of the viaduct with DeLorme or GE (blame the lo-res imagery), I can't provide a better estimate as to its mile marker location.
Mile Marker 304.4

Linn Cove Viaduct, a design and engineering marvel, skirts the side of Grandfather Mountain. Visitor center and trails.

properties.name: Linn Cove Visitor Center
properties.description:
At least is should be near here. Neither DeLorme nor GE show it.

While there, take a look at the Linn Cove Viaduct. It should be near here as well and is a engineering marvel. Rather than putting the parkway road surface on the ground, they raised it up into the air.

This was done as part of an agreement with the previous owners of the land. For a long time, this portion of the parkway was left uncompleted because the owners of the time would not sell. The agreement to put the road in the air solved that problem.

properties.name: Beacon Heights Overlook
properties.description: At least I think this is it.  That overlook did not show up in DeLorme.  Furthermore, this location was not listed in DeLorme.  However, I know Beacon Heights Overlook is near here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description:
DeLorme shows a short loop here that looks like an overlook, but no name is provided.
The following information is from Wikipedia. I show the mile marker as 309.22.
Mile Marker 308.3

Flat Rock is worth the walk for the superb view of Grandfather Mountain and Linville Valley.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: Again, DeLorme shows a looping road here, but no name.  This might be Linville Falls Visitor Center.  However, the maps I have showing the center are rather low res.

properties.name: Linville Falls
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I could not provide an estimate on the mile marker because GE is the only program showing the falls and it shows them on the other side of the town Linville Falls from the parkway. This makes it unlikely you will be able to see the falls from the parkway. Looks like you need to use SR 183 to reach them.
Mile Marker 316.3

Linville Falls roars through a dramatic rugged gorge. Trails to overlooks.

properties.name: Chestoa View
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I am not providing a mileage estimate as I can't locate this postion.
Mile Marker 320.7

Chestoa View trail provides outstanding scenery.

properties.name: Humpback Mountain
properties.description: DeLorme shows the road splitting into two one way roads here.

properties.name: Museum of North Carolina Minerals Visitor Center
properties.description:
Location is an estimate. I really only know where to get off the parkway. None of the maps that listed it showed where it was precisely. However, the mile marker estimate should be good as the only pace to get off there is at Gillespie Gap.
The following information is from Wikipedia. I estimate the mile marker to be 331.4.
Mile Marker 331

Museum of North Carolina Minerals interprets the state's mineral wealth.

properties.name: Deer Gap Overlook?
properties.description:
DeLorme shows what appears to be an overlook here, but does not name it.  This is another case where it shows a looping road next to the parkway.

I based the name on the gap that DeLorme showed here.  If that is incorrect, please let me know.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: I found a looping road, this time named.  It is Sweetwater Rd.  So this might be Sweetwater Lookout.

properties.name: Horse Trail Gap
properties.description: From the name, you might be able to find some horse trails here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme shows a looping side road here, but no name.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: Both DeLorme and GE show an unnamed looping road here.

properties.name: Mt Mitchell
properties.description:
The highest point in the US east of the Mississippi River.

For your convience, I have provided both the mile marker for the overlook and where to get off.  The overlook mile marker can be found at the Mt Mitchell Overlook.  The mile marker that you would get off  the parkway to visit the park and, if desired and allowed, the mountain is listed in the park placemark and the gap where you need to get off (Black Mountain Gap).

properties.name: Mt Mitchell State Park
properties.description:
You need to leave the parkway at Black Mountain Gap (roughly mile marker 351.62). Look for SR 128.
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 355.4

Mount Mitchell State Park, reached via N.C. 128, has a picnic area, lookout tower, and the highest point east of the Mississippi River.

properties.name: Mt Mitchell Overlook
properties.description:
This is roughly Mile Marker 349.39. I list it in case you want to view Mt Mitchell without leaving the parkway. To visit the state park or the mountain, leave the parkway at Black Mountain Gap.
I also found this in Wikipedia. I could not find a match for the name. Nor did the falls mentioned show up. However, the mile marker mentioned is near here by my estimate.

The following information is from Wikipedia.
339.5 Crabtree Meadows Walk to Crabtree Falls. Campground.

properties.name: Black Mountain Gap
properties.description: You need to leave the parkway here to visit Mt Mitchell or Mt Mitchell State Park.  Look for SR 128 at roughly mile marker 351.62.

properties.name: Bullhead Overlook?
properties.description: GE (but not DeLorme) shows an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby gap and mountain.

properties.name: Craggy Gardens Visitor Center
properties.description:
Well, DeLorme had something here with that name. There appears to be a visitor center somewhere near here. So I am assuming there is a vistor center here. The location shown is based on where DeLorme showed the name "Craggy Gardens". Because I could not determine a more precise location, I am declining to quote a mile marker estimate.
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Markers 363.4 to 369.6

Craggy Gardens appear covered with purple rhododendron in mid to late June. Craggy Pinnacle Trail and other trails (364.1 and 364.6); road to picnic area and trails (367.6).

properties.name: Unknown Tunnel
properties.description: This tunnel appears on one of the scanned maps I found.  However, DeLorme does not show it.  The scanned map does not list tunnel names.  The PDF map lists tunnels in the legend, but no tunnels appear on the map itself in this area.  At least look like a tunnel thanks to the high res imagery.

properties.name: Uknown Lookout?
properties.description: GE (but not DeLorme) shows an unnamed looping side road here.

properties.name: Possible Location of the Folk Arts Center
properties.description: I am working on confirmation.

properties.name: Park Headquarters
properties.description:
Thanks to the high res imagery, I can see something. However, DeLorme shows only Hemphill Knob at this location.

I thought it might be the The Folk Art Center mentioned by Wikipedia. However, that appears to be several miles to the southwest based on my mile marker estimate.

Fortunately, RudiNoodle has told me that it is the Park heaquarters.

properties.name: The Folk Art Center
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. The location is based on the quoted mile marker.
Mile Marker 382

The Folk Art Center offers sales and exhibits of traditional and contemporary crafts of the Appalachian region. Intrepretive programs, gallery, and library.

properties.name: Mount Pisgah
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I could not identify an intended vantage point or overlook. However, the closest approach is at the Little Pisgah Ridge Tunnel. My estimate is the mile marker would be 404.43. I do not know how they obtained the mile marker shown below. That might be an overlook on down the road.
Mile Marker 408.6

Mount Pisgah was part of the Biltmore Estate. The estate became home of the first forestry school in America and the nucleus of the Pisgah National Forest.

properties.name: Unknown Lookout?
properties.description: There appears to be a lookout here.  I can see an unnamed looping side road at this locaiton in GE and DeLorme.

properties.name: Unknown Lookout?
properties.description: There appears to be a lookout here.  I can see an unnamed looping side road at this locaiton in GE and DeLorme.

properties.name: Unknown Lookout?
properties.description: There appears to be a lookout here.  I can see an unnamed looping side road at this locaiton in GE and DeLorme.

properties.name: Devil's Courthouse
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. My esitmate for the closest approach to the formation is 424.37. However, based on the mile marker quoted by Wikipedia, you might look for an overlook farther east.
Mile Marker 422.4

Devils Courthouse is a rugged exposed mountaintop rich in Cherokee traditions. A walk to the bare rock summit yields a spactular view of Pisgah National Forest.

properties.name: Beech Gap Overlook?
properties.description: GE (but not DeLorme) shows an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby Beech Gap.

properties.name: Tanasee Bald Overlook?
properties.description: GE (but not DeLorme) shows an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby bald.

properties.name: Richland Balsam
properties.description:
The highest point along the entire parkway is near here from what I can tell.
The following information is from Wikipedia. The mile marker closest to the mountain is 433.77. However, there is an overlook (I think) just down the road. Since the Wikipedia mile marker is 2+ miles before mine, you might look for an overlook to the south east.
Mile Marker 431

Richland Balsam's self-guiding trail takes you through a remnant spruce-fir forest. Highest point on the parkway, 6,047 feet.

properties.name: Lone Bald Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby bald.

properties.name: Locust Gap Overlook
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby gap.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unnamed looping road here.

properties.name: Flat Gap Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby gap.

properties.name: Licklog Gap Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby gap.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unamed looping road here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unamed looping road here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unamed looping road here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unamed looping road here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unamed looping road here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: Both GE and DeLorme showed an unnamed looping side road here.

properties.name: Woodfin Falls Overlook?
properties.description: Both GE and DeLorme show an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby falls.

properties.name: Woodfin Falls
properties.description: If the nearby overlook does look over these falls, then I might have used the wrong icon.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: Both GE and DeLorme showed an unnamed looping side road here.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: DeLorme (but not GE) showed an unnamed looping side road here.

properties.name: Mt Lyn Lowry Overlook?
properties.description: Both GE and DeLorme showed an unnamed looping side road here.  I based the name on the nearby mountain.

properties.name: Waterrock Knob Visitor Center
properties.description:
The following information is from Wikipedia. I estimate the mile marker to be 453.23.
Mile Marker 451.2

Waterrock Knob provides a panorama of the Great Smokies, visitor center, trail, confort station, exhibits.

properties.name: Unknown Overlook?
properties.description: Both DeLorme and GE showed an unnamed looping side road here.

properties.name: Heintooga Overlook?
properties.description:
The only hint of an overlook here was a mention that Heintooga Overlook was 1.3 miles from the southwestern end of the parkway. My measurements show that to be here. You will note that it is within .1 miles of two other overlooks.
The following information is from Wikipedia.
458.2 Heintooga Overlook spur road goes to a mile-high overlook 1.3 miles from the parkway.

properties.name: Southwestern End
properties.description:
This appears to be Mile Marker 470.63 by my measurements.
The following information is from Wikipedia.
Mile Marker 469

Southern End of the Blue Ridge Parkway intersects with U.S. 441 in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park and the Cherokee Reservation.

properties.name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park
properties.description: Great Smoky Mountains National Park

properties.name: Cherokee Reservation
properties.description: Cherokee Reservation
